.. py:function:: outlabel(ax, label)

   Adds a label just outside the top left corner of a plot (outside the axes).

   :param ax: The ``Axes`` object to annotate
   :type ax: Axes
   :param label: The label to be added
   :type label: str

   :rtype: The :py:class:`matplotlib.text.Text` instance created


.. py:function:: inlabel(ax, label)

   Helper function to add a text label inside of the axes to `ax`.

   :param ax: The ``Axes`` object to annotate
   :type ax: Axes
   :param label: The label to be added
   :type label: str

   :rtype: The :py:class:`matplotlib.text.Annotation` instance created representing the inserted label.


.. py:function:: figax(fig = None, ax = None)

   Create figure and axes-object if an axes-object is not supplied.

   :param fig: The optional figure to use as a basis for `ax` if the latter is not provided. Defaults to None.
   :type fig: Figure | SubFigure | None, optional
   :param ax: The axes object provided. Will be used to populate `fig` if provided.. Defaults to None.
   :type ax: Axes | None, optional

   :returns: A complete combination of figure and axes.
   :rtype: tuple[Figure | SubFigure, Axes]


.. py:function:: extrude(x, y, xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)

   Calculate the endpoint of extrusion of the point (x,y) from point (0,0) until it intersects either x or y boundary.

   :param x: Coordinates of the vector to extrapolate
   :type x: float
   :param y: Coordinates of the vector to extrapolate
   :type y: float
   :param xmin: Bounds of the rectangle to the edge of which the
                ray should be extended
   :type xmin: float
   :param xmax: Bounds of the rectangle to the edge of which the
                ray should be extended
   :type xmax: float
   :param ymin: Bounds of the rectangle to the edge of which the
                ray should be extended
   :type ymin: float
   :param ymax: Bounds of the rectangle to the edge of which the
                ray should be extended
   :type ymax: float

   :returns: The position at the end of the extrusion, where the origin-ray through (x,y) intersects the boundary of the axes.
   :rtype: tuple[float, float]


.. py:function:: mpl_imshow_png(ax, png, **imshow_kws)

   Helper function to display an image from a bytestream input, e.g. an encoded png in axes.

   Removes axes labels from `ax`.

   :param ax: The ``Axes`` object into which to plot
   :type ax: Axes
   :param png: The bytestream data of the image to plot
   :type png: bytes

   :rtype: ``AxesImage``, as returned by ``ax.imshow``
